intro: Tarenna lasiorhachis, commonly known as the rough-stemmed tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, elliptical leaves with a rough texture. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, typical of the Rubiaceae family.
